__TOC__


This is a simple wiki page to have a list of upcoming <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay|UbuntuBugDays]]</nowiki>.

Be sure to check out <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+upstreamreport]]</nowiki> along with the old <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/BugDayFocus|Bug Day Focus]]</nowiki> history, this will make the choosing of future focuses easier.

If you want to help to organize a Bug day, please look at the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Organizing| Organizing Page]]</nowiki>

When arranging a Hug Day it is quite helpful to get developer(s) of the package involved.  <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DeveloperResponsibilities | Developer Responsibilities]]</nowiki> is a good reference for finding out whom to contact.

=== Ideas ===
# < persia> Another idea would be to do a day for patch integration: there's lots of bugs with patches out there.  Perhaps have a day where a couple people offer a quick -classroom session on testing/applying/requesting upload for patches every 4-6 hours, and people chase the list of bugs with the patch flag set.
## bdmurray has some stuff that will help <nowiki>[[ Bugs-Patches | here ]]</nowiki>
# < persia> Something else we used to do for fun was keyword bugdays.
## < persia> One of my favorite was "time".
## < persia> Basically, pick a word, and do a bugsearch with the word.  Find one with about the right number of bugs.
# tagging bugs hug day, create multiple pools of bugs that need to be tagged, example: mark as bitesize the bugs with patches that need to generate a debdiff in order to get bug fixed.
# Hug days for each new default application before they are included in a release of Ubuntu.
# Kernel bugs with patches attached (<nowiki>[[KernelTeam-KernelPatches|How to handle Kernel bugs with patches]]</nowiki>)
